org.protune.core
Class ProtuneFilterEngine

java.lang.Object
  org.protune.core.ProtuneFilterEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
FilterEngine, Status
public class ProtuneFilterEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements FilterEngine, Status

NOTE: This class is still work in progress.
The current implementation of the interface FilterEngine. As inference engine an istance of TuPrologWrapper is used.
In order to avoid duplication, for each negotiation only a copy of the negotiation state should be present in the system. Since at each negotiation step a copy is held in the inference engine contained in the ProtuneFilterEngine, it is pointless implementing another copy somewhere else in the system, as the inference engine itself can act as a(n implementation of the interface) Status. Actually this interface is not directly implemented by the inference engine but by the ProtuneFilterEngine class. Therefore the ProtuneFilterEngine class implements both the interface FilterEngine and Status.

Author:
jldecoi

isNegotiationSatisfied

public boolean isNegotiationSatisfied(Status status)
Checks whether the overall goal of the negotiation is satisfied (i.e. whether it can be proved according to the current state of the peer).

Specified by:
isNegotiationSatisfied in interface FilterEngine
Parameters:
status - In this implementation of the interface FilterEngine it is not used (the policy available on the peer is loaded into the inference engine at construction time - see ProtuneFilterEngine(Mapper, Policy)}).
Returns:
true if the overall goal of the negotiation is satisfied (i.e. if it can be proved according to the current state of the peer), false otherwise.

filter

public FilteredPolicy filter(Policy policy,
                             Status status,
                             Action request)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Returns the filtered policy protecting the action, whose execution was asked for by the other peer. The filtering is performed according to the policy available on the peer and according to its current state.

Specified by:
filter in interface FilterEngine
Parameters:
policy - In this implementation of the interface FilterEngine it is not used (a ProtuneFilterEngine is an Status as itself).
status - In this implementation of the interface FilterEngine it is not used (a ProtuneFilterEngine is an Status as itself).
request - An action, whose execution was asked for by the other peer.
Returns:
The filtered policy protecting the action, whose execution was asked for by the other peer. The filtered policy is computed according to the current state of the peer and according to its local policy.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

Description copied from interface: FilterEngine

Returns:
